cover_section.author: Anil Izci
cover_section.purpose: This document serves as a comprehensive knowledge base to assist users in understanding and managing the Average Days to Enter Time metric. It covers FAQs, policy details, and troubleshooting guidance to ensure compliance and efficiency.
cover_section.audience: This document is intended for timekeepers, billing support teams, and business intelligence analysts.

stored_procedure.name: sp_saDaysToEnterTimeDetailRpt
stored_procedure.purpose: Generates detailed reports on the average number of days it takes for timekeepers (lawyers) to enter their time into the system.
stored_procedure.author: Bethac Fisher
stored_procedure.usage: Executed ad hoc by the billing help line to provide timecard/date-level details focusing on the average days to enter time.

key_logic_steps.description: Retrieves the timekeeper index and period end date; cleans up any existing temporary tables.
Checks if the period end date is before September 30, 2023. If true, prints 'No applicable data' and terminates.
Creates #origindex to map original time indices by joining the Timecard table with itself multiple times.
Processes job status data using CTEs and populates the final job data table.
Calculates run dates based on business days and creates a Calendar table with a range of dates.
Adjusts title-related data and establishes date ranges based on run dates.
Filters out specific matters (e.g., secondments, summer matters) from the report.
Computes the average days to enter time using weighted differences between work and entry dates.
Selects relevant fields and orders the final output by timekeeper details and work date.

output_fields.description: Date used for calculating average days to enter time.
Weighted difference in dates for average calculation.

faq.question: How does the sp_saDaysToEnterTimeDetailRpt procedure handle data validation?
faq.answer: It checks if the period end date is before September 30, 2023. If true, it prints 'No applicable data' and terminates.

faq.question: Why are summer and secondment matters excluded in the procedure?
faq.answer: They are excluded to avoid including seasonal or specific arrangements that do not align with standard performance metrics.

faq.question: What should be done to create test data for partner reset as of 8/9/2023?
faq.answer: Set the value to 91 when the current date is less than 10/1/23 to create test data for partner reset.

faq.question: Why is the average days to enter time no longer needed to reflect to 1 decimal as of 8/9/2023?
faq.answer: As of 8/9/2023, all timekeepers are now reflected to 1 decimal (or whole numbers for partners), making the previous logic obsolete.

faq.question: How should the average days to enter time be calculated for partners with no decimals?
faq.answer: For partners, show the average as a whole number; for associates/counsel, use one decimal place.

general_guidelines: Time diaries must be submitted on the first business day following the day the time was worked.
If daily reporting is not possible, time for the week must be entered no later than the Monday of the following week.
All time entries must be current by the end of the month.

questions.question: Who do I call when I have a question regarding Intapp Time?
questions.answer: Direct your questions to the Firmwide Billing Help Line at (312) 853-7790 (x3-7790) or billinghelpline@sidley.com.

questions.question: My Intapp seems to be syncing longer than usual when I open a new delegate's calendar?
questions.answer: The initial sync can take several minutes the first time you load a delegate’s calendar.

questions.question: Can I rearrange columns in the list view (grid mode)?
questions.answer: Yes. You can rearrange, add, or remove columns using drag-and-drop or the customization gear.

questions.question: My calendar no longer displays the days I am over or under required hours. How do I restore that view?
questions.answer: Use the Appearance tab in settings to adjust target hours and enable highlight for above/below required hours.

questions.question: Why are my Open/Sent/Finalized timecards not displayed in red/green/maroon on the calendar?
questions.answer: Ensure you are on the correct calendar view by selecting 'View Sent/Open/Finalized' from the Change View Menu.

questions.question: Why do some dates have a star on the calendar?
questions.answer: Dates with a star indicate holidays on the Intapp Time calendar.

questions.question: Can I sort my timecards?
questions.answer: Yes. Click on a column header in list view to sort the timecards accordingly.

questions.question: How can I view open timecards?
questions.answer: Apply a filter for 'Ready to be Sent' or 'Not Ready to be Sent' on the calendar view or clear filters in list view.

questions.question: Can I change the color scheme?
questions.answer: No, the color scheme is fixed.

questions.question: How can I adjust the number of recent days shown in my calendar?
questions.answer: Use the Appearance tab in settings to modify the Recent Entries Days.

questions.question: Can I change where the cursor starts on a new time entry?
questions.answer: The cursor always starts in the matter field; use Shift+Tab to move backward.

questions.question: How do I access my templates and timers?
questions.answer: Templates are available via the Templates tab; timers are accessed via the Timer button.

questions.question: Can I edit a timecard once it has been finalized?
questions.answer: You may edit the narrative and task/activity codes via the Time Narrative Webpage. For other fields, contact the Billing Help Line.

questions.question: How do I copy timecards?
questions.answer: In a new time entry, use the 'Copy from Recent' icon or copy and paste from list view.

questions.question: I requested my time entry be transferred to a new matter. Why is it still showing under the old one?
questions.answer: Updates to finalized timecards are synchronized back to Intapp approximately every two hours.

questions.question: How do I view my narrative shortcuts or firm codes?
questions.answer: Click the Narrative Codes icon in the narrative field to search for codes.

questions.question: Is there a list of Intapp Time keystrokes?
questions.answer: Yes. Click here for a list of Intapp Time keystrokes.

questions.question: Can I create a template from a recent entry?
questions.answer: Yes. Use the Templates tab and select 'Copy from Recent' to create a new template.

questions.question: How do I report for a day?
questions.answer: Select the day on your calendar, click the printer icon, and choose your desired report format.

questions.question: How can I view my entries in the order I entered them?
questions.answer: Use the 'Timesheet Report by Create Date' to view entries in chronological order.

questions.question: I have multiple open timecards for one day; I only want to send timecards for one matter. How do I do that?
questions.answer: Use the filter icon to search by client matter number or use list view filtering.

questions.question: I tried sending multiple timecards and received a failure message. How do I know which one failed?
questions.answer: Check the status field in red for error details. In list view, sorting by the Status column can help.

questions.question: My calendar shows conflicting entries. What is causing this?
questions.answer: Conflicts occur when an online secretary and offline lawyer edit the same entry. Use Intapp Time’s conflict resolution feature.

questions.question: What work location should I use if the lawyer is working from home?
questions.answer: Select the appropriate city or state. If the city is not listed, choose the state.

questions.question: What work location should I select if the location is not listed?
questions.answer: For U.S. locations, choose 'Other US.' For non-U.S. locations, choose 'Other Non-US.'

questions.question: The lawyer is on a flight. Which location code should be used?
questions.answer: Decide whether to use the origination or destination location.

questions.question: Should I create separate timecards if work is started in the office and finished at home?
questions.answer: No, choose either the origination or destination location based on where the work was performed.

questions.question: Where is calendar integration on Intapp Time when I am in Citrix?
questions.answer: Intapp Time does not integrate with Citrix. Log in via the desktop application to access your calendar.

questions.question: Can I view my delegate's Outlook calendar in Intapp Time?
questions.answer: No, Intapp Time is specific to the operator and does not display delegate calendars.

overview.purpose: Ensures that time entries are clear, accurate, and consistent...
key_principles: Review entries for clarity and consistency.

common_spelling_punctuation_and_grammar.sentence_case: Entries should be in sentence case with proper nouns capitalized.
common_spelling_punctuation_and_grammar.professional_presentation: Entries must be professionally presented and easy to read.
naming_conventions: Use first initials followed by a period and last name (e.g., 'M. Smith').
Do not include titles (e.g., Mr., Mrs.) or full first names.
common_spelling_punctuation_and_grammar.punctuation: Avoid terminal punctuation; entries are typically phrases.
common_spelling_punctuation_and_grammar.abbreviations: Avoid abbreviations unless client guidelines specify otherwise.
common_spelling_punctuation_and_grammar.verb_usage: Use present-tense verbs in all entries.
common_spelling_punctuation_and_grammar.spell_check: Run spell-check and do a manual review before finalizing.

quality_guidelines.clarity_consistency_accuracy: Ensure narratives are clear, consistent, and accurately reflect services performed.
correct_client_and_matter_numbers: Always use the correct client-specific matter numbers.
Verify if unsure with the responsible lawyer or billing specialist.
detailed_entries: Avoid vague phrases such as 'attention to' or 're same.'
Provide detailed descriptions (e.g., 'Telephone call from M. Smith to discuss deposition delay for expert witness Jane Doe.').

block_billing.definition: Listing grouped tasks in one entry is known as block billing.
issues: Block billing may be rejected by clients; it often requires time-consuming adjustments.
preferred_practices: Itemize each activity with its own time value.
E.g.: .30 Prepare redline...; .40 Prepare financial support agreement; .80 Draft legal opinion.

responsibilities.summary: Lawyers must record time accurately and timely...
key_points: Provide enough detail so clients understand services rendered.
responsibilities.questions: Direct questions to your billing partner.

daily_time_reporting.policy: Lawyers are required to record time daily or by the first business day following the work date.

exceptions.weekly_reporting: If daily reporting isn’t feasible, time must be entered by the following Monday.
exceptions.month_end_requirement: All time must be entered by the end of the month.
exceptions.transaction_completion: Time must be current by the completion of a transaction.

daily_time_reporting.system_monitoring: The system tracks the average days taken to enter time for each lawyer.
daily_time_reporting.compliance_goal: 0 to 5 days is the target range.

reporting_actual_time.policy: Time should reflect the actual work performed.
prohibitions: Do not inflate time to appear more productive.
reporting_actual_time.escalation: Report billing concerns to your billing partner.

required_daily_hours.requirement: A minimum of 7.5 hours daily, not all must be billable.
non_billable_time: Record small increments under 'Other Time' for non-billable tasks.
Unassigned work should be charged to a personal matter number until reassigned.
required_daily_hours.unassigned_time_policy: Unassigned time must be reassigned by the 1st or 15th...
required_daily_hours.missing_time_reporting: Days with fewer than 7.5 hours are flagged and reported.

telephone_conferences.policy: Calls longer than momentary duration must be recorded under the appropriate client matter number.
guidelines: Record in appropriate increments as agreed with the client.
Longer calls should reflect actual duration.

travel_time.policy: Travel time is recorded based on client arrangements...
guidelines: Travel time may be chargeable if work is performed during travel.
Double billing for overlapping travel time is prohibited.
travel_time.escalation: For travel time queries, contact your billing partner or Local Practice Group Head.

possible_causes: Entries were finalized after the cutoff.
solutions: Assign entries to a valid Client Matter Number.

possible_causes: Late submissions with large hours affect the weighted average.
solutions: Request a breakdown of weighted entries from the BI Help Desk.

Ensure leave entries are recorded as '1'.

common_issues.issue: Vacation or leave entries incorrectly impact the metric.

Coordinate with HR/Billing to validate leave periods.

common_issues.issue: Finalized entries not reflected in the current metric.
possible_causes: Entries finalized after the snapshot time.
solutions: Finalize all entries before 8:00 p.m. CT.

q_and_a.question: What happens if I miss the deadline to enter my time?
q_and_a.answer: Missing the deadline can impact your Average Days to Enter Time metric and compliance status. Please enter and finalize your time as soon as possible.

q_and_a.question: What is the impact of late entries on my bonus?
q_and_a.answer: Late entries can increase your average days to enter time, potentially reducing your bonus.

q_and_a.question: Does the Average Days to Enter Time metric include weekends and holidays?
q_and_a.answer: Yes, it uses calendar days, which include weekends and holidays.

q_and_a.question: How often is the stored procedure run?
q_and_a.answer: It is typically executed ad hoc by the Billing Help Line.

q_and_a.question: What data does the stored procedure exclude?
q_and_a.answer: It excludes summer matters, secondments, and certain unassigned matters.

q_and_a.question: What happens if I enter my time but forget to finalize it?
q_and_a.answer: Time entries that are not finalized are not included in the metric.

q_and_a.question: Can unassigned time entries cause compliance issues?
q_and_a.answer: Yes. Unassigned time must be reassigned by the 1st or 15th of the month, or it may trigger a violation.

q_and_a.question: If I work on weekends, when should I enter my time?
q_and_a.answer: Weekend work should be finalized by the next business day for compliance.

q_and_a.question: What should I do if my entries are flagged as missing after finalizing?
q_and_a.answer: Verify entries were finalized before the snapshot cutoff. If the problem persists, contact the BI Helpdesk.

q_and_a.question: Why are some of my entries excluded from the report?
q_and_a.answer: Entries might be unassigned or finalized after the period, or related to excluded matters.

q_and_a.question: Are there video tutorials for entering time?
q_and_a.answer: Yes, tutorials like 'Using Intapp Time on Your Sidley Laptop' are available. Contact the Billing Help Line for links.

q_and_a.question: Who do I contact if I’m locked out of the time entry system?
q_and_a.answer: Please contact the Sidley BI Helpdesk for login assistance.

q_and_a.question: What should I include in a time entry narrative for client review?
q_and_a.answer: Provide a clear, concise description of the task performed, including relevant matter numbers.

q_and_a.question: Can abbreviations be used in narratives if the client allows them?
q_and_a.answer: Generally avoid abbreviations unless explicitly approved by client guidelines.

q_and_a.question: What happens to the metric if I am out of the office for an extended period?
q_and_a.answer: For approved leave or secondments, entries are assigned a value of '1' so your average is not penalized.

q_and_a.question: How does entering vacation time affect my compliance?
q_and_a.answer: Vacation time entered in advance may calculate as 0 days. However, actual work during vacation should still be entered promptly.

q_and_a.question: Can I contest an entry that negatively impacted my metric?
q_and_a.answer: Yes, contact the Sidley BI Helpdesk to review or validate the entry.
